reviewText:
The menus a little broken.
The handling is a little wonky and unlikeable.
Money comes in slowly, and winning races with small tracks is not fun at all.
As you upgrade your truck it starts to easily make wheelies from smallest things. It is not fun.
The game doesn't give any sort of competitive feeling.

Trucks cost a fortune (cheapest are 1 million). So do some upgrades (actually affordable but still pricey). Too boring to try to get that money.

Also, I really did not want to try multiplayer as it did not show if there were players actually searching for game or anything. Also the truck handling is terrible so it really doesn't make it worth the wait.

Lots of other things to annoy.

Should be free2play.

reviewText:
Had this game on my I-phone for a while, Always enjoyed it there, was a good time killer when such is needed. Saw it was now avalible on PC, so I decided to give a go, despite the negative review's, at 4.99 I figured it wouldn't be a big loss if it was atrocious. The PC version is...A little different and takes some getting used to. The control physics seem to be a little improved over the Mobile version of this game. The truck's don't roll over as easily as they do in the mobile version.

This game can be frusturatingly challanging at times, due in part to the A.I. which flucuate's from being professional badass's who set record time's around the track (Almost unfairly it seems at times) to being complete ♥♥♥♥♥'s who couldn't navigate their way out of a wet paper bag.

One of my favorite feature's of this game is the fact that they offer a few vintage trucks...Bigfoot #1 and the Original USA-1 trucks is pretty cool to see, since these beasts of the 1980's are the one's I grew up watching.

The game has a few more features than it's mobile counterpart which is a plus.

The rest of the game is fairly underwhelming, but what do you expect for a five dollar mobile port? The Graphics are sub-par by todays standards, the sound quality is monotonous, the soundtrack is simple...Offering very limited tracks, but in fairness they stay true to the nature of ''Monster Trucks''.

So, to summerize, the controls are somewhat clunky, the sound is avarage, the graphic's are Playstation 2 Era quality. But if you love Monster Trucks, especially the 1980's Alumni, and you are willing to see past this games short comings and just enjoy it for what it is, you can't go wrong.

Overall Score 6/10

Graphics = 5
Sound = 5
Controls = 5
Replayability = 7
voteText: 14 of 20 people (70%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I got this game for free via a friend of mine and i honestly can say that this game is not really well executed.
I think that the idea is pretty cool and all that, but the execution is pretty poor as far as i can see.


Pros:
1. Good performance. Steady 60 FPS and no noticable drops.

Cons:
1. It's an obvious mobile port. Mobile ports are mostly not good. This is a good example.
2. The game is heavily farmable. You gain next to no money.
3. There are no control settings (Apart from sensitivity... wait, what?) nor any tutorial.

Verdict:
Game has good performance with it's 60 FPS, but that's about the only positive thing. The game lacks a lot of basic features a PC port needs. In short, this game is not recommended.

reviewText: Menus don't work at all. Controller support is lacking immensely... I edited Monster Truck Madness 1&2 for ages, and this  game gave me great hope for an awesome monster truck game in my adult life. Could we PLEASE get an update, and or, patch to fix these issues??

reviewText:
This game has alot of major flaws that need to be fixed immediately. I have no control over what I am doing as in choosing different types of gameplay myself. The only keys that work in each section for me are:

Main Menu: Esc. , Enter/Space

In Game: Arrowkeys/WASD (Going backwards does not work)

When I try to select any options with my mouse, nothing happens. I mouse over what I want to do in the game and absolutely nothing happens. The only way to exit the game (in fullscreen) is to CTRL+ALT+DEL out of it. I just exit the program in windowed mode. I have nothing bad to say about the actual driving part besides it is a little too difficulty when you are force to buy one of the weaker trucks first, maybe if you guys tune the trucks that the computer runs down a little bit, it would be a lot more enjoyable for a younger audience that would get frustrated to quickly.

I do really think this game has alot of potential. All it needed was a little more time put in to it before its release date. From what I have seen on the trailers of the game it looks great, and that's really what I wanted this game to be. I'm sorry to say it but I can not reccomend this game yet, but like I said before, a little tweaking to this game and it could shoot all the way to the top.

P.S. I would also like to say that I have the mobile game for an Apple device, which I have nothing bad to say about. Not to criticize you about another one of your guys's programs, but I see alot of updates are being released for Android phones/tablets and it would be nice if you could release them for Apple devices. I have no idea if you guys have any plans for that, but it would be great.

reviewText:
Yes! As of 27/7/2015 there is CONTROLLER SUPPORT! :D THANK YOU for adding that, developers!

At last, it's properly playable on a PC and it's a fantastic game.

The only downside has to be the menus - they're really scrappy and not really functioning well with the controller, but thankfully there's a mouse pointer for that. It would be lovely to see an update to tidy up the menus in the future.

That said, the gameplay is top notch. At the price it's on here for, you won't get better monster truck physics anywhere else.. it's tough as nails but great fun too, with lots of content to keep you busy :)

reviewText: I just rebought and downloaded this game today, and I have to say that, with the exception of an extremely slow framerate issue when all of the graphics are turned all the way up, the game is 100% better over the state is was in at launch. The graphics are nice and crisp, even with the adjustements to handle the chugging, and it looks like something I expect to see on Steam or a console.The controller mapping is very intuitive, too. I really like the way mouse movements were integrated into the mapping, meaning that I don't have to put down the controller after a race. At the time that I'm writing this, I've done about 12 races, all on the Eastern Championship and I only ran into one time where I had to restart the race because the lights glitched out and I couldn't move. I'm so glad that you guys took our criticisms to heart and really put in the leg work to make this game every bit the experience we thought it could be. I can safely say that I'd recommend this game to anyone I know who's a fan of monster trucks or of this game in general. Even with the framerate issues. Which I hope, and I have no real doubts, will be fixed.

reviewText:
Excellent port of the famous tablet game. The game can run smoothly on most computers, which is great. Its the exact same thing as the tablet version, but with better graphics, smoother gameplay, and MUCH BETTER controls. It even has the multiplayer, which unfortunately. doesnt seem to work well (I am unable to start a game with someone, but I do connect to other players, but it takes a too long time to make the game start), but I'm sure its a thing that is getting improved as I am typing. Even though this isnt a free game, unlike the Android version, i'd say buy this PC port. You dont get ads, and you get better graphics, controls and smooth gameplay for a very cheap price. I still do think the game could be improved. A truck maker or a track maker could make the game much more interesting (I'm not saying it isnt interesting right now), although its not something we desperately need, but just an idea.


In a nutshell, its a great game, and I would rather stay on the PC version than on the tablet version.

reviewText:
I'm very debated on this. Then again this is coming form a guy that hasn't played the android version so it's your call to take it. This game, from it's truck selection seems almost like some sort of annaversary to all the trucks that has entered, then again, it's missing quite a lot like gravedigger, madusa, and such. It feels good on controls (since it's just the arrow keys(or wasd) And when you find out where the checkpoints are, you can easily cut corners once you're frustrated enough.
Yeah, it can get frustrating. Pretty much your truck, every truck, is a rubber toy where any bump turns into a ping pong mess. Trying to race and control your truck can become a draining task yet I personally want more. If they lightened the physics a tad bit then this would be fun hands down.
Now the potential in this is great. if they turned this into an actual console/PC game I could see it mixed with Monster Jam: Path of Destruction (my fav so far)  To create your truck and add team races and accessable to 4 players. It has good potential, and I can see why poeple love it so much.
I'll continue play this, but it's of asking yourself how much frustration can you stand. That or toss out you compeditive side and just goof off and hope you make progress.
It's a shame they force us to vote on the game, because I don't think I can recommend, nor dislike the game from people, it's just, I want more to it.

reviewText:
with pretty much everything working in the game now, i love it. the only things i wish where in the game now is a create a truck option and a level editor, ignore most of the negative reviews as A LOT of them where made when the game was broken on launch day.

pros
+Tons of tracks which include racing on the same track you raced on just like the real thing
+Nice detructive system including cars that can be crushed body panels and tires flying off the truck and even fully destructable campers
+Wide range of monster trucks, with big names like bigfoot and monster patrol
+Trucks are upgradable, you can upgrade the engine, shocks, transmission, intake, exhaust.
+3 tour regions
+physics are REALLY good, but it does have its flaws (look down below for a small explanation)

cons
-No mod support
-No level editor
-Can't create your own truck or paint job
-Physics can be a little silly sometimes making truck saves seem very unrealistic
-No one plays multiplayer (Freestyle battle)
-way to many team bigfoot trucks (there is 19 team bigfoot trucks out of the 43 trucks. this could be a + if you REALLY like bigfoot)

about the physics that can be silly at times, when the truck is on its side you can most of the time about 85% to 90% of the time save the truck by pointing the tires towards the sky rather than pointing them towards the ground. but other than that, the physics are actually really good.

now to hope they make a 2nd monster truck destruction and add a level editor and truck editor with physics more on the simulation side rather than the arcade/sim based physics (wishful thinking though)

my score
8/10

reviewText: Fun and cheap monster truck game with lots of truck choices, three championship modes and multiplayer.  You also can buy upgrades for your trucks.  Now there is controller support and I've had no glitches so far.  This is a mobile port I believe so dont expect too much from the graphics.  As stated already the ai sometimes can be flawless and hard to beat but other times you are sitting at the finish line waiting on them to finish.\n\nOverall my two year old and I has enjoyed playing Monster Truck Destruction.  If you are wanting a Monster Truck game there may be better ones out there (I dont know) but if you can get this for a cheap price I say give it a shot!

reviewText:
Monster Truck Destruction  A Monster Truck game.

Pro:
Playable also with XBOX-Controller
You can buy many different trucks with money you receive ingame
Good graphics
Contra:
German translation is bad
Possible things the developers could add:
Cards and Achievements
Smoother controls
This is my first impression. More is coming soon.

reviewText:
I dont know what the negative comments are about but they have NO clue what theyare talking about.
Pros:
1. Controls are really easy to master
2. The graphics are GREAT
3. It's crazy cheap when on sale

Cons:
1. AI needs to be dumbed down a bit because they are way too fast in racing and win all the time in freestyle


I recommend   11/10

reviewText:
Worst Monster Truck themed game I have ever experienced!

Graphics = sucks
Audio = sucks
Control = sucks
Menus = sucks
Options = sucks
Glitches = absolutely in there just like everybody else says

However, I said there boy, However! ... I like the concept and the track layouts. This could have been a great game, if somebody else would have made it.

Good thing I got it on sale for 99 cents. I'll keep it in my library just for sentimental Monster Truck reasons. LOL
